58.title: LISTEN: Curious Robocall Seeks 'Damaging' Information on Moore
58.article: Bill Riales -UPDATE 3:31 p.m. (WKRG) -- The Executive Editor, Marty Baron, of the Washington Post released the following statement:"The Post has just learned that at least one person in Alabama has received a call from someone falsely claiming to be from The Washington Post. The call's description of our reporting methods bears no relationship to reality. We are shocked and appalled that anyone would stoop to this level to discredit real journalism."Facebook LIVE: Roy Moore speaks at a rally in Jackson, Alabama.https://www.facebook.com/WKRG.News.5/videos/10155918062607500/Another development involving the U.S. Senate race in Alabama. At least one person in our viewing area received a robocall seeking more damaging information about Roy Moore. Here is the text of that voicemail message received by Pastor Al Moore in Creola."Hi, this is Bernie Bernstein, I'm a reporter for the Washington Post calling to find out if anyone at this address is a female between the ages of 54 to 57 years old willing to make damaging remarks about candidate Roy Moore for a reward of between $5000 and $7000 dollars. We will not be fully investigating these claims however we will make a written report. I can be reached by email at albernstein@washingtonpost.com, thank you."Pastor Moore says he's baffled about who might be behind the message. He said he sent a response to the email address provided but it came back undeliverable. We also tried the email address with the same result.John Rogers with the Roy Moore campaign says it's the first he's heard of this type of robocall. We contacted the Washington Post but it would be highly unlikely that a newspaper would offer thousands of dollars for information, damaging or otherwise. We searched and could not find a record of a 'Bernie' or 'Al Bernstein' who works as a reporter at the Washington Post.If any of you have received the same call, please let us know at producers@wkrg.com

59.title: Barack Obama’s Remarks in St. Paul
59.article:
Barack Obama delivered a heartfelt speech in St. Paul, expressing admiration for his former rival Hillary Clinton and recognizing her historic journey as a woman in politics. Despite their differences throughout the campaign, Obama emphasized Clinton's commitment to the American people and her unwavering determination to bring about positive change.

Congratulating Clinton on her victory in South Dakota and acknowledging her impressive campaign, Obama highlighted her decades-long dedication to public service. From her work at the Children's Defense Fund to her fight for healthcare as First Lady and her Senate career, Clinton has consistently demonstrated her passion for improving the lives of ordinary Americans.

Obama reassured the audience that Clinton would play a vital role in future achievements, particularly in the battle for universal healthcare and the transformation of energy policy. He affirmed the Democratic Party and the country as a whole are stronger because of Clinton's contributions, stating that he is a better candidate for having had the privilege to compete with her.

Addressing the notion that the primary has caused division within the party, Obama countered by highlighting its positive impact. He applauded the millions of Americans who cast their ballots for the very first time, implying that the primary process has galvanized new voters and brought them into the political fold.

Barack Obama's remarks in St. Paul served as a unifying message, recognizing Clinton's accomplishments and emphasizing the collective effort required to bring about positive change in the country. Despite their past disagreements, Obama's words reflected a sense of unity within the Democratic Party and a shared mission to improve the lives of ordinary Americans.

60.title: First family visits D.C. shelter, highlights homeless veterans’ plight
60.article: President Obama, alongside his family, serving Thanksgiving dinner to the homeless Wednesday night at Friendship Place in Washington. (NICHOLAS KAMM/AFP/Getty Images)President Obama, joined by his wife and daughters, served Thanksgiving dinner in a D.C. shelter Wednesday to highlight the administration's efforts to end homelessness among U.S veterans.The first family visited Friendship Place, which is located in the basement of St. Luke’s Church in Northwest Washington. The shelter, which received a $3.1 million grant from the Department of Veterans Affairs this year to improve its capacity to address veteran homelessness, operates the program Veterans First, a leading provider of housing services to veterans and their families in the area that currently serves 550 households.The Obamas, along with some friends, served dinner as part of the shelter's "Feast with Friends" event. Each member of the family had assigned duties: The president served turkey and ladled gravy; Michelle Obama distributed vegetables; Malia doled out mashed potatoes; Sasha gave out stuffing and cranberry sauce and Marian Robinson dished out macaroni and cheese."We appreciate you,” the president said, asking another, “How you been?"Obama also asked those partaking in the meal if they preferred white or dark meat.The White House, which first launched an effort to end homelessness in June 2010, has intensified its push targeting homeless veterans this year. The mayors of the 25 cities with the largest populations of homeless veterans in the nation have publicly pledged to end veteran homelessness in their communities by the end of this year, and Virginia announced on Veterans Day it had become the first state to end homelessness among those who have served in the military.[For one night, trying to make each homeless person count]Homelessness among American veterans declined 36 percent between 2010 and January 2015, according to White House officials, with unsheltered homelessness among veterans decreasing by 50 percent during that same period.

61.title: Rick Perry Switched to GOP at a Younger Age Than Reagan, According to Reports
61.article:
On his Aug. 30 radio program, conservative commentator Sean Hannity noted that Texas Gov. Rick Perry's switch from the Democratic to the Republican party years ago puts him in the same company as the nation's 40th president.

Perry revealed in a conversation with Reagan's son, Michael, that he had become a Republican at an earlier age than Ronald Reagan himself. Perry stated, "I love your dad, and he was part of the reason I became a Republican, but I became a Republican sooner in my life than your dad did."

The statement prompted a discussion of the ages at which both leaders made their party switch. Reagan, according to historian Edward Yager, was registered as a Democrat when he voted for Franklin Roosevelt in 1932 at the age of 21. Reagan began supporting Republican candidates while still registered as a Democrat, endorsing Dwight Eisenhower in 1952 and 1956, and Richard Nixon in 1960.

Reagan officially registered as a Republican in the fall of 1962 when he was 51 years old. This registration occurred during an event where Reagan was speaking in favor of Nixon's gubernatorial bid in California, and a woman who was a registrar placed a Republican registration card in front of him.

Perry, on the other hand, won his first election as a Democrat in 1984 and served as a Democrat until he switched parties in 1989. Perry made the announcement during a press conference at the age of 39, stating that he intended to continue voting based on his convictions, with the only difference being an 'R' beside his name.

Based on this information, it can be concluded that Perry switched to the Republican party at a younger age than Reagan did. Perry was 39, while Reagan was 51 when they made the switch.

Overall, Perry's statement that he became a Republican at a younger age than Reagan is rated as True.

62.title: Just another WordPress site? Think Again!
62.article:
In a shocking turn of events, the seemingly innocuous website, "Just another WordPress site," has been exposed as a hub for fake news and misinformation. What once appeared to be a typical blog or personal site, has been revealed to be a carefully crafted platform for disseminating misleading information to unsuspecting readers.

A team of investigative journalists uncovered the truth behind this so-called "WordPress site," discovering a network of anonymous contributors who were paid to fabricate stories ranging from political scandals to health fads. These stories were then shared on social media, spread rapidly, and ultimately contributed to a culture of disinformation and confusion.

The creators of "Just another WordPress site" have yet to be identified, but experts warn that this type of deception is becoming increasingly common in today's digital landscape. It is up to each individual to carefully evaluate the sources of their news and information, to avoid being misled by malicious actors.

So, if you thought "Just another WordPress site" was just another blog, it's time to think again. This website is a clear example of how easily fake news can be spread online if we are not vigilant in our media consumption.

63.title: The Texas "Unmiracle"
63.article:
As anticipated, Texas Governor Rick Perry has officially declared his candidacy for the presidency. It comes as no surprise that his campaign will heavily emphasize faith in miracles. While these miracles may allude to biblical tales, Perry's focus will likely shift to a more secular subject if he secures the Republican nomination – the supposed economic miracle that Texas purportedly experienced during the Great Recession thanks to conservative economic policies. Perry will argue that he can replicate this success on a national scale to restore prosperity to America.

However, it is crucial to understand that the so-called Texas miracle is nothing more than a fallacy. Moreover, the Texan experience offers no valuable lessons on how to achieve national full employment.

Undeniably, Texas faced the recession slightly later than the rest of the nation, primarily due to its energy-focused economy benefitting from high oil prices in the initial half of 2008. Additionally, the state was relatively sheltered from the worst impacts of the housing crisis, attributable in part to surprisingly stringent mortgage lending regulations.

While these factors contributed to delaying the onset of recession and minimizing the housing crisis's impact, they do not validate Texas' economic policies or suggest their effectiveness in achieving widespread national prosperity. In truth, Texas faces numerous challenges, including inadequate healthcare, high poverty rates, and a lack of economic equity. These issues cannot be ignored in any evaluation of the state's economic performance.

Furthermore, the claim that conservative economic policies alone can be universally applied to revive America's economy is unfounded. Economic conditions, demographics, and social structures vary significantly across states, making a one-size-fits-all policy ineffective.

It is essential to approach claims of economic miracles with skepticism and a critical eye. While political campaigns often utilize catchy slogans and simplistic narratives, they rarely offer comprehensive solutions to complex issues.

64.title: Fox News accidentally puts up a poll graphic that shows how they are the least trusted network and its description UPDATE 4/12/2018
64.article:
In a recent incident, Fox News put up a poll graphic that showed how the network is the least trusted among all the news networks. The graphic displayed on the screen for a few seconds during Tucker Carlson's show. The graphic compared the ratings of various news networks and displayed their percentage of trustworthy viewers.

To the surprise of the viewers, Fox News ranked last with only 30% trustworthy viewers. CNN came out on top with 65%, followed by MSNBC with 55%. The graphic was quickly removed from the screen, but it was too late as viewers had already captured screenshots and shared it on social media.

Fox News was quick to respond to the incident, stating that it was a mistake made by an intern who accidentally put up the wrong graphic. According to Fox News, the graphic that was displayed had nothing to do with the network's ratings or trustworthiness, but it was a comparison of the number of viewers in different time slots.

Fox News also pointed out that the confusing graphic wasn't actually showing that Fox is the least trusted network. They further explained that the network has consistently been the most-watched news channel for over 17 years now.

The incident has sparked outrage among Fox News viewers, who accused the network of misleading them. Many people have taken to social media to express their frustration and demanded an explanation from the network.

The incident has once again brought to light the issues of media bias and credibility. With the rise of fake news and alternative facts, it is important for the news networks to maintain their credibility and integrity. However, incidents like these only serve to further erode the trust that people have in the media.

In conclusion, while the incident may have been a mistake, it has certainly left a lasting impact on the viewers, and it is up to Fox News and other networks to restore the trust that people have in them.

65.title: Barack Obama Claims Mitt Romney Condemned Coal-fired Power Plants as "Killers"
65.article:
In a recent campaign rally, Mitt Romney expressed his support for coal miners and their jobs, emphasizing the importance of coal-fired power plants in Ohio and the surrounding areas. Romney argued that the environmental regulations implemented by President Barack Obama's administration could potentially lead to job losses and increased electricity costs for residents of Ohio.

However, the Obama campaign quickly responded to Romney's statements, asserting that his position on coal has drastically changed since his time as the governor of Massachusetts. They specifically referenced quotes from Romney in February 2003, shortly after he was elected governor, where he condemned certain coal-fired power plants in Massachusetts, claiming they were responsible for fatalities and posed significant health risks.

The Obama campaign highlighted three key statements made by Romney during a heated debate over the future of the Salem Harbor Power Station, a coal-burning plant in Boston:

1. "That plant kills people" - Romney's reference to Salem Harbor Power Station.
2. "I will not create jobs that kill people" - Romney's commitment to prioritizing public health over job creation.
3. "If the choice is between dirty power plants or protecting the health of the people of Massachusetts, there is no choice in my mind. I will always come down on the side of public health" - Romney's unwavering stance on safeguarding public health.

It is important to note that Massachusetts had implemented new rules in 2001 to reduce emissions from power plants, including nitrogen oxide, sulfur dioxide, carbon dioxide, and mercury. Salem Harbor Power Station was among the plants singled out as significant polluters, and a Harvard study estimated that it caused various health issues, including premature deaths, emergency room visits, asthma attacks, and upper respiratory symptoms.

While some individuals disputed the figures from the Harvard study, claiming they were based on unproven modeling, the study's methodology has since been replicated and is respected by health scientists. Romney, at the time, seemed to accept these findings, as evidenced by his own statements in news releases and his hiring of environmental experts from the Conservation Law Foundation.

To ascertain the accuracy of the Obama campaign's claim and the severity of Romney's views on coal emissions, experts and environmentalists were consulted. They confirmed that Romney's condemnation of the Salem Harbor plant was part of his wider commitment to emissions reductions, which aligns with the standards later proposed by the U.S. EPA, the same standards Romney now criticizes.

Furthermore, an analysis comparing the emissions levels of Salem Harbor Power Station to those of coal-fired plants in the Midwest revealed that the former had lower or comparable emissions of nitrogen oxides and sulfur dioxide, two pollutants known to be hazardous to health. This implies that if one were to support the regulations Romney advocated for in 2003, they would likely also support similar measures on a national scale.

In conclusion, while Romney made reference to a specific power plant, his comments were part of a broader emissions-reduction initiative that he championed as governor, indicating a consistent viewpoint on coal emissions and public health. Therefore, the Obama campaign's claim about Romney's stance on coal, although focusing on a single plant, holds significant truth based on historical records and contextual analysis.

On the Truth-O-Meter, the claim made by the Obama campaign rates Mostly True.

66.title: Seattle's Historical Woes and Current State of Affairs
66.article:
In recent years, Seattle has seen many changes, both good and bad. While the city enjoys a thriving economy and a bustling tech industry, it also faces issues such as homelessness and rising living costs.

But Seattle's history is just as colorful. Did you know that the city was originally built on top of a dangerous swamp? Or that the famous Space Needle was built for the 1962 World's Fair? These are just a few interesting facts about Seattle's past.

Despite its problems, Seattle remains a beautiful and culturally rich city. Its vibrant neighborhoods, delicious food, and stunning natural scenery continue to draw in tourists and new residents alike.

To bring awareness to the positive aspects of Seattle and address its challenges, a local blog has been launched for Seattleites and visitors alike. The blog offers an open news portal and discussion forum for anyone interested in learning more about Seattle's history and present state of affairs.

By supporting their native Seattle, its residents hope to create a community that is welcoming and inclusive to all. So come join the conversation and help make Seattle an even better place to live and visit.

67.title: Lance Armstrong's Twitter Photo Goes Viral, Sends Shockwaves Through the Cycling Community
67.article:
Lance Armstrong, the former cycling champion who was stripped off his Tour de France titles after it was revealed he had used performance-enhancing drugs, has stirred up controversy once again. In a bold move, Armstrong posted a photo on his Twitter account that shows him relaxing with seven yellow jerseys.

The picture has gone viral and has sent shockwaves through the cycling community. Armstrong's post has been met with outrage from fellow cyclists who feel that he is still refusing to take responsibility for his actions.

In the photo, Armstrong is seen sitting in a luxurious villa with seven yellow jerseys arranged neatly around him. The jerseys, representing his seven Tour de France titles, are a clear message from Armstrong. He still wants the world to know that he won those titles, despite having cheated to achieve them.

Armstrong's tweet was immediately met with criticism, with many accusing him of being disrespectful to the sport of cycling. Some also pointed out that he should be using his position of influence to raise awareness about the importance of clean competition in sports.

As expected, Armstrong remains defiant. In a subsequent tweet, he wrote: "I won those yellow jerseys fair and square. They can't take that away from me." The controversy surrounding Lance Armstrong shows no signs of abating anytime soon, and it remains to be seen what the consequences of his latest stunt will be.

68.title: Inside a Fake News Sausage Factory: ‘This Is All About Income’
68.article: In Tbilisi, the two-room rented apartment Mr. Latsabidze shares with his younger brother is an unlikely offshore outpost of America’s fake news industry. The two brothers, both computer experts, get help from a third young Georgian, an architect.They say they have no keen interest in politics themselves and initially placed bets across the American political spectrum and experimented with show business news, too. They set up a pro-Clinton website, walkwithher.com, a Facebook page cheering Bernie Sanders and a web digest of straightforward political news plagiarized from The New York Times and other mainstream news media.But those sites, among the more than a dozen registered by Mr. Latsabidze, were busts. Then he shifted all his energy to Mr. Trump. His flagship pro-Trump website, departed.co, gained remarkable traction in a crowded field in the prelude to the Nov. 8 election thanks to steady menu of relentlessly pro-Trump and anti-Clinton stories. (On Wednesday, a few hours after The New York Times met with Mr. Latsabidze to ask him about his activities, the site vanished along with his Facebook page.)“My audience likes Trump,” he said. “I don’t want to write bad things about Trump. If I write fake stories about Trump, I lose my audience.”Some of his Trump stories are true, some are highly slanted and others are totally false, like one this summer reporting that “the Mexican government announced they will close their borders to Americans in the event that Donald Trump is elected President of the United States.” Data compiled by Buzzfeed showed that the story was the third most-trafficked fake story on Facebook from May to July.So successful was the formula that others in Georgia and other faraway lands joined in, too, including Nika Kurdadze, a college acquaintance of Mr. Latsabidze’s who set up his own pro-Trump site, newsbreakshere.com. Its recent offerings included a fake report headlined: “Stop it Liberals…Hillary Lost the Popular Vote by Several Million. Here’s Why.” That story, like most of Mr. Latsabidze’s work, was pilfered from the web.Mr. Latsabidze initially ran into no problems from all his cutting and pasting of other people’s stories, and he even got ripped off himself when a rival in India hijacked a pro-Trump Facebook page he had set up to drive traffic to his websites. (He said that the Indian rival had offered $10,000 to buy the page, but that he had reneged on payment after being provided with access rights and commandeered it for himself.)

69.title: Leonardo DiCaprio Tells President Obama That He's Going to Mars
69.article: Leonardo DiCaprio has sailed on the Titanic, battled grizzly bears in the brutal Wild West, and explored dreams. Now, though, the 41-year-old actor says he’s going to travel to Mars — but for real.Well, at least that’s what he told President Barack Obama.DiCaprio was at the White House on Monday night as part of the South by South Lawn event. The actor, the president, and climate scientist Dr. Katharine Hayhoe took the stage towards the end of the evening for a conversation on climate change before the U.S. premiere of DiCaprio’s new documentary on the subject, Before the Flood.The subject of Mars and SpaceX came up while Hayhoe was talking about the need to make people connect with the reality of climate change on a universal, human level. “The most important thing to do is not to pile up scientific reports until they reach a tottering pile of about 8 feet where they tip over and crush somebody,” Hayhoe said, explaining that what really matters when trying to motivate people to combat climate change thing is to connect its real meaning and impact to “what’s in our hearts.”“The reality of it is, if you’re a human living on this planet — which most of us are, yeah?” she joked. “As long as we haven’t signed up for the trip to Mars. I don’t want to know if anyone has, I think you’re crazy.”Article continues below Get a weekly round-up of the most essential Elon Musk news sent to your inbox. Sign up for our newsletter: sign upAs Hayhoe expressed her belief that anyone who was on board with Elon Musk’s recently detailed plans for a possibly deadly trip to Mars was nuts, DiCaprio chimed in to say, “I did.”Hayhoe attempted to assure the famous actor that she didn’t actually think he was nuts, but Obama jumped in.“I think he’ll acknowledge he’s crazy,” the president said with a smile.It’s unclear if the millionaire actor really plans on traveling to Mars and quite possibly dying in the process. Remember, though, Leo finally won an Oscar for his role in The Revenant, in part due to the brutal conditions he endured while filming it. Maybe, just maybe, he figured the only place tougher than frozen uncharted western territories is the Martian surface. The Academy would love it.It’s probably method acting, is what we’re saying.Earlier in the night, Obama made a Star Trek reference while talking about the importance of flawed but useful energy sources like fracking and nuclear power. “Until we invent the perfect energy source — Lithium crystals or whatever, Scotty’s there beaming us up — but until then we need to live in the real world,” Obama said.

In the name of fear and political exploitation of anti-gun rhetoric, a citizen’s Second Amendment rights have been ripped away from him by the government.The new “red flag” law, which has taken hold in other states already, allows the courts and law enforcement to take away guns from individuals they deem are dangerous and they’ve just begun the confiscation. The man was not identified by authorities.** MORE GUN CONFISCATION COVERAGE at Liberty Headlines **Neighbors complained that the man had been “staring” at people through storefront windows while wearing a holstered firearm. He was not brandishing his weapon by any account, and open carrying is legal in the area, so he was abiding by the law. Handguns are semi-automatic…Original Source

71.title: Whoopi Goldberg Reacts to Fake News about Getting Handcuffed and Dragged Out of TV Studio
71.article:
Whoopi Goldberg, the beloved co-host of The View, has been the center of a fake news report. A fabricated article claimed that the FBI humiliated and arrested Goldberg for her involvement in a hoax. However, there is no truth to these claims. 

Goldberg took to Twitter to debunk the fake news and expressed her disappointment in those who try to spread false information. She said, "It's sad that some people have nothing better to do than to make up stories about me. I'm still here, continuing to do what I love, and won't let these fake reports bring me down." 

This incident highlights the dangers of fake news and how it can easily be spread through social media. It is essential to fact-check before sharing information and not to believe everything that you read online. 

In conclusion, Whoopi Goldberg was not handcuffed or dragged out of her TV studio. It is a false and baseless claim that should not be given any credibility.

72.title: Obama's Health Care Speech to Congress
72.article:
In a highly anticipated speech to Congress, former President Barack Obama laid out his vision for a comprehensive health care plan that aims to improve the lives of millions of Americans. Titled "Making Health Insurance Work for You," the plan seeks to address several critical issues faced by individuals and businesses alike.

Under this proposed plan, insurance companies would no longer be able to deny coverage based on pre-existing conditions, a significant concern for many Americans. Additionally, the bill, once signed into law, would prohibit insurance companies from terminating coverage when individuals fall sick or reducing coverage when it is needed most. The implementation of arbitrary caps on coverage amounts, both yearly and throughout a lifetime, would also be deemed unlawful.

Recognizing the burden of out-of-pocket expenses, the plan seeks to establish limits on the amount individuals can be charged, ensuring that no American goes bankrupt due to medical bills. Furthermore, routine check-ups and preventive care, such as mammograms and colonoscopies, would be covered by insurance companies at no additional cost. The objective is to detect diseases like breast and colon cancer at an early stage, effectively saving lives and reducing healthcare costs.

For the tens of millions of Americans currently without health insurance, the second part of the plan promises to offer quality, affordable choices. The proposal introduces a new insurance exchange – a marketplace where individuals and small businesses can compare and purchase health insurance at competitive prices. Insurance companies would be incentivized to participate in this exchange to cater to millions of potential customers. This approach aims to mirror the affordable insurance options enjoyed by large companies and government employees.

To ensure accessibility for those unable to afford the lower-priced insurance available through the exchange, tax credits will be provided based on individual needs. Moreover, all insurance companies seeking access to this new marketplace must abide by consumer protection regulations.

However, disregarding the availability of affordable options, there may still be individuals, particularly the young and healthy, who choose to forgo coverage. Likewise, there may be companies that refuse to provide their workers with health care benefits. This irresponsibility has a financial cost for the rest of society. The burden often falls on taxpayers when uninsured individuals require expensive emergency room visits, and it puts businesses providing adequate healthcare at a disadvantage compared to their competitors.

Obama urged everyone to do their part, emphasizing that widespread participation is crucial for successful implementation of the proposed insurance reforms. Without a collective effort, crucial elements such as the coverage of pre-existing conditions would be unachievable.

The former president concluded by pressing on the importance of embracing affordable options for all Americans, emphasizing that access to proper healthcare should not be a luxury but a fundamental right. With this comprehensive plan, he aimed to provide greater security, stability, and opportunity for millions of Americans.

73.title: Crystal Meth Babysitter Eats 3-Month-Old Baby
73.article:
to, Missouri - The quiet Missouri town of De Soto was rocked by the gruesome discovery of a three-month-old baby who was found partially eaten by their babysitter, who was high on crystal methamphetamine. The babysitter, who authorities have declined to name, had been hired by the parents of the infant while they went out for the evening. Later that night, the babysitter started to exhibit erratic behavior, which eventually led them to turn into a cannibal.

The police were alerted to the gruesome scene by neighbors who heard suspicious noises coming from the house. When they arrived, they were met with a horrifying sight. The babysitter was found covered in blood, with parts of the infant missing. The police acted quickly and arrested the babysitter on suspicion of murder.

The parents of the infant, who were understandably distraught, issued a statement expressing their deep sadness and shock at what had happened. "We trusted this person with our baby, and we never thought anything like this would happen. Our hearts are broken, and we are still trying to come to terms with what has happened," the statement said.

The incident has sparked outrage in the local community, with many people calling for stricter background checks and drug testing for babysitters. "This is a horrific tragedy that never should have happened. We need to ensure that people who are taking care of our children are properly vetted and free from substance abuse," one local resident said.

As for the babysitter, they are currently being held in custody and facing charges of murder and cannibalism. The trial is expected to be a long and difficult process, with many people still reeling from the shocking nature of the crime.
